page.title: 06A day in a farmer's life 2
page.content: After breakfast there are many jobs that may need done. Machinery may need to be fixed. If it is the winter he will take hay to the cows in the fields. If it is summer he will have to look after pregnant cows. When a cow has had a calf, the calf and mother must be separated. This is a difficult task and will need everyone to help. After lunch crops must be seen to and then at four o'clock the milking must be done again. Mr Edgar goes to bed at 10 o'clock after he has checked the animals. Sometimes if a cow is calving or sick he does not go to bed.
